intro: Monsonia betschuanica, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
